moves.1. d4: I want to play the old benoni and avoid the queens gambit and queens pawn games.
moves.1... c5 2. dxc5: Most unusual and it caught me off guard.
moves.3. Nf3: White is not concerned about his pawn here because it is not a true gambit.
moves.3... Bxc5 4. e3: This bishop attacking this diagonal is a central theme in this game.
moves.5... a6: Preparing to drive away his bishop
moves.6. Nc3 d5 7. Bb3 Nc6: No immediate threats to my kingside so I develope my c knight with my eye on d4
moves.8. O-O O-O 9. a3: I really did not understand this move
moves.9... d4: white is forced to flee his knight or take with the pawn.  If he does the former he will not have a good square for his knight
moves.10. exd4 Nxd4 11. Nxd4 Bxd4: I still have pressure on his f2 square
moves.12. Ne2: And now he decides to eliminate the attacker
moves.12... e5: I should have retreated my bishop because I might need him later in the game since it is an open game.
moves.14. Bg5 Bg4: I develop my light squared bishop doing a pin of my own.  Notice he cannot do f3 because he would be in check by my dark squared bishop
moves.15. Qxd8 Raxd8: In hindsight I should have taken back with the bishop because he can take my knight and double up my pawns on the kingside
moves.16. Ng3: first he must find a safe square for his knight.
moves.16... h6: h6?  why not Rd6?  A big blunder on my part.
moves.17. Bxf6 gxf6 18. Ne4: Now the knight goes after the doubled pawn.
moves.18... Kg7: I try defending both pawns with my king.
moves.19. Kh1: White wants to attack my light squared bishop
moves.19... f5 20. Ng3 Rd2: Now im double attacking his b pawn and his once guarded f pawn
moves.21. f3: He finally attacks my bishop but I take his b pawn threatening his bishop
moves.23... Kg6: guarding my h6 pawn but look at my kings position on the board and then look at his!
moves.25. Ne4: White blunders here.  He should have taken the bpawn and I just simply take his a pawn and run for protection.
moves.25... Bxa3 26. Rf6+ Kg7 27. Rf3 b5: Now i get my bpawn into play
moves.28. Nd6 Bxd6: White blunders here and i take the knight for free.
moves.30. Rxa3 Bxa3 31. c4: tempting to take but I advance it instead
moves.31... b4 32. h4 Rc8 33. Kh2: Now ill queen a pawn now that i can take his c pawn.
